title: Cannot find Thunderbird Passwords
content:
I have Thunderbird version 102.8.0

All the help advice I've found tell me to open the menu - three horizontal lines and go to Options. Alternatively, do the same but go to Preferences. Another suggestion is to Open Tools in the toolbar and go to Options. Options does not appear since I updated.

In Menu, after the e-mail settings, I get : File View Go Message Events and Tasks Tools Help Exit

None of these offer any links to Options, Preferences or Passwords.
creator: jphilweybr

title: Correo: Cabecera bien pero con el cuerpo de otro
content:
Buenos días.

Tengo las cuentas de empresa con google y configuradas con thunterbird. El problema es que algunos correos, lo que es la cabecera del correo en thunterbird esta bien pero el cuerpo de ese mensaje es de otro correo electrónico. Si entro en gmail a través de google si está tanto la cabecera como el cuerpo bien, pero en thunterbird cuando se ha descargado el correo de gmail el cuerpo lo ha cogido de otro mensaje. No se de que puede ser. Parece algo de sincronización??
creator: rjerez

title: Liberar espacio histórico correos
content:
Buenos días,

Llevo usando Thunderbird desde hace 8 años para el trabajo, almacenando correos, pero ha llegado al punto de que el disco lo tengo lleno, y más de la mitad lo ocupa Thunderbird.

¿Hay alguna forma de extraer todos esos correos de años anteriores a un archivo externo de consulta, para almacenarlo en un disco externo y así liberar espacio del disco del equipo?

También tengo la duda de, si hay forma de hacerlo, ¿cómo evitar que vuelvan a sincronizarse correos con el buzón IMAP de Google, para que no vuelva a llenarse de los correos antiguos?

Quedo a la espera de pronta respuesta y ayuda, por favor.

Gracias de antemano.

Un saludo
creator: ccabezudo

I have 5 accounts some of which are pop3, and timed to poll every 30 minutes. If I know there is a messages waiting I used to be able to click the Get Messages button and choose the account.

If this is the way it's meant to work, is it possible to roll back to the previous version ?

Thanks for reading. Rob

title: Configurazione Gmail Account non funzionante
content:
Thunderbird v102.8.0 (64 bit) Windows 11 22621.1265

Da circa 2-3 settimane non riesco a configurare gli account GMAIL. Altri provider funzionano senza problemi.

Le configurazioni automatica rilevate da Thunderbird sono corrette, sia IMAP che SMTP, ho provato anche ad inserirle manualmente ma nulla cambia.

Ho disattivato totalmente l'antivirus (quello di windows) Ho anche creato una password per l'APP dal profilo del mio account GMAIL, come suggerito sul web.

Non funziona in nessun modo, l'errore che riscontro è il seguente: "Impossibile autenticarsi sul server. La configurazione, il nome utente o la password potrebbero essere errati"

è un bug di Thunderbird?

Grazie

title: Gmail non funziona con Thunderbird
content:
I haven't been able to set up GMAIL accounts for about 2-3 weeks. Other providers work without problems.

The automatic configurations detected by Thunderbird are correct, both IMAP and SMTP and OAuth2, I also tried to enter them manually but nothing changes.

I have completely disabled the antivirus (the windows one) I also created a password for the APP from my GMAIL account profile as suggested on the web.

It doesn't work at all, the error I get is the following: "Failed to authenticate to the server. The configuration, username or password may be incorrect"

Also I already have several gmail accounts that work on Thunderbird, the problem occurs when I add a new one, or if I remove a working one and try to add it again.

is this a Thunderbird bug?

Thank you
creator: giacomosilli

title: BT Internet SMTP refuses to work with Thunderbird
content:
I'm trying to help someone migrate to Thunderbird.

They have a BT Internet email account.

After entering the settings, incoming mail works successfully, but outgoing mail fails every time with an error.

The error is

Login to server mail.btinternet.com with username xxx@btinternet.com failed. Followed by

Sending of the message failed. Unable to authenticate to Outgoing server (SMTP) mail.btinternet.com. Please check the password and verify the 'Authentication method' in 'Account Settings | Outgoing server (SMTP)'.

BT says the settings are:

Outgoing Mail Server: mail.btinternet.com Port: 465 (this may not be automatically populated on selecting SSL, so you'll need to check) SSL Encryption: Enabled (but not STARTTLS) ** I have used the SSL/TLS setting Authentication: PLAIN ** I have selected normal password Username: your email address including the @btinternet or @btopenworld.com part Password: your btinternet or btopenworld password

Have I missed something obvious? It's driving me NUTS!
creator: mark442

that is every server. Can someone help with this please?

title: salvataggio/duplicazione rubrica locale tramite procedura autonoma fuori thunderbird tra 2 pc
content: Buongiorno e grazie ai volontari della disponibilità. Come da oggetto, ho necessità di clonare giornalmente da un pc sorgente la sola rubrica locale di thunderbird 102.6.1 con procedura batch esterna a tb (autonoma, di notte, ovviamente a tb chiuso) su un pc destinazione. dal pc sorgente ho copiato i files e cartelle appese sottopercorso al profilo locale; sulla destinazione ho restorizzato il solo sottopercorso nella struttura nel nuovo profilo (già esistente) e le cartelle locali ci sono correttamente, ma la rubrica è vuota. Ho anche copiato a parte i soli file abook.mab e history.mab da sorgente a stesso sottopercorso destinazione (recano date di aggiornamento al 2018 ? anche se ieri ho inserito un contatto) inutilmente. I contatti sono tutti nella rubrica pc sorgente definita locale in tb (niente sincronizzazioni imap o caldav) e sono tutti presenti... So che è possibile usare l'esporta da rubrica, ma l'utente non la farà mai: debbo provvedere con file batch automatico di copia notturna. Per favore, qualcuno mi sa dire dove si trova (realmente) il o i file della rubrica locale, di modo da poterlo copiare e salvare periodicamente? un caloroso ringraziamento per il tempo dedicatomi.
creator: marino_negro

title: Inbox IMAP Folder in Thunderbird under Ubuntu
content:
Hello

I have two accounts in a IMAP server which support shared folders. I'll call them Email-A and Email-B. I have grant all ACL IMAP permissions on Email-B folders to my user of Email-A.

Then in Thunderbird I've subscribed all folders of Email-B from my account of Email-A. So I can see the inbox, sent, etc folders of Email-B in the tree of folders into my Email-A account.

But when I exit from Thunderbird and I start Thunderbird again, the inbox folder of Email-B has disappeared, it doesn't visible. I can see the other folders of Email-B, but not inbox folder of Email-B.

If I unsubscribe the inbox folder and then I subscribe that folder again, it appears in the tree folder until I exit from Thunderbird. After when I open Thunderbird, the inbox folder again isn't visible.

This problem is in Thunderbird under Ubuntu (linux). In Thunderbird under Windows there is not problem: the inbox folder of Email-B is always visble. In both of them, I have the version 102.7 of Thunderbird.

So it looks like there is a bug in linux version of Thunderbird

Jorge
creator: informatica10

title: Slow E-mail with Centurylink
content: Oct 2022: Hard Drive replacement. Dell Inspiron 15 3000. Prior to hard drive crash, no problems using Thunderbird and Centurylink. Nov-Dec 2022: Windows started "taking over." Constant Windows “Recovery”, collecting data and restarts. Thunderbird very slow, especially downloading. Constant “can not connect or Thunderbird has disconnected”. Constant "IMAP can’t recognize" statements. Nov-Dec 2022: Centurylink upgrade, move to new platform. As far as I know, no pre-notification to let customers know. Jan 2023: Windows and Thunderbird still a problem. Feb 2023: Removed Windows (clean sweep) and uninstalled Thunderbird/Mozilla. Reinstalled Windows. Reinstalled Thunderbird.  As of 27 Feb 2023: To date, no Windows problems.  Thunderbird still extremely slow for hours. Deleted files manually deleted return “on their own”. o Still constant “Server mail.centurylink.net discontinued.” According to Centurylink, it is not an internet problem since I can access internet with no problems. They insist it is a Thunderbird issue; that Thunderbird needs to make a changes/adjustments to coordinate with Centurylink since the Centurylink upgrade. I’m now using Centurylink web mail but I prefer Thunderbird. Help please?
creator: gardendreamer
